intro: Chlamysporum menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' chlamysporum, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of the western United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath or heather family. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
